name: Agent
description: AutoGPT's primary Agent; uses one-shot prompting.

ai_profile.ai_role: an AI writer specialized in crafting informative articles on the evolutionary journey of GPT models, highlighting key advancements, challenges, and future implications.

resources: Internet access for searches and information gathering.
The ability to read and write files.
You are a Large Language Model, trained on millions of pages of text, including a lot of factual knowledge. Make use of this factual knowledge to avoid unnecessary gathering of information.
constraints: Exclusively use the commands listed below.
You can only act proactively, and are unable to start background jobs or set up webhooks for yourself. Take this into account when planning your actions.

You are unable to interact with physical objects. If this is absolutely necessary to fulfill a task or objective or to complete a step, you must ask the user to do it for you. If the user refuses this, and there is no other way to achieve your goals, you must terminate to avoid wasting time and energy.
Ensure the article is factually accurate and avoids speculative information.
Maintain a neutral and unbiased tone in discussing the evolution of GPT models.
best_practices: Continuously review and analyze your actions to ensure you are performing to the best of your abilities.
Constructively self-criticize your big-picture behavior constantly.
Reflect on past decisions and strategies to refine your approach.
Every command has a cost, so be smart and efficient. Aim to complete tasks in the least number of steps.
Only make use of your information gathering abilities to find information that you don't yet have knowledge of.
Thoroughly research and incorporate the historical milestones and technical improvements that shaped the evolution of GPT models.
Provide clear explanations with a concise and engaging writing style to captivate readers and maintain their interest.
Discuss the impact of GPT models on various industries and applications, showcasing their significance in the field of artificial intelligence.
Incorporate current trends and future projections to offer a comprehensive overview of the ongoing developments in GPT technology.

task: I want Auto-GPT to write a short article about the evolution of gpt models

config.default_cycle_instruction: Determine exactly one command to use next based on the given goals and the progress you have made so far, and respond using the JSON schema specified previously:

action.name: web_search
action.reasoning: This will provide a solid foundation for the article on the evolution of GPT models and set the stage for discussing their impact and future implications.

result.outputs:
## Search results
### "A Look into the Evolution of GPT Models From GPT-1 to GPT-4"
**URL:** https://generativeai.pub/a-look-into-the-evolution-of-gpt-models-from-gpt-1-to-gpt-4-38b68c2f275b  
**Excerpt:** "The journey from GPT-1 to GPT-4 is a story of technological evolution and a testament to human ingenuity and our relentless pursuit of knowledge. Each iteration of the GPT models has brought us closer to the dream of creating machines that can truly understand and generate human-like text, opening up a world of possibilities that were once ..."

### "GPT Evolution: Shaping AI and Transforming Society | Medium"
**URL:** https://medium.com/@DigitalQuill.ai/the-history-and-evolution-of-gpt-from-gpt-1-to-gpt-4-ai-chatgpt-724c7f15f72d  
**Excerpt:** "5. GPT vs. Rule-Based AI Models. Adaptability: GPT and other machine learning models learn from data and improve over time, unlike rule-based models which follow predefined rules and lack flexibility."

### "The Story of ChatGPT and OpenAI: The Evolution of GPT Models"
**URL:** https://medium.com/illumination/the-story-of-chatgpt-and-openai-the-evolution-of-gpt-models-abf201316a9  
**Excerpt:** "The Evolution of GPT Models. 2018: OpenAI releases GPT-1, a language model with 117 million parameters trained on a dataset of approximately 8 million web pages."

### "GPT Series and Evolution — Upstage"
**URL:** https://en.content.upstage.ai/blog/insight/evolution-of-gpt-models  
**Excerpt:** "GPT-3.5 (MARCH 2022) GPT-3.5 is a version with code data and Instruction fine-tuning added to GPT-3. According to the speculation of many researchers, it is not known whether this method directly affects the model, but it is observed that adding code data increases GPT's reasoning ability and understanding of long inputs."

### "GPT-1 to GPT-4: Each of OpenAI's GPT Models Explained and Compared - MUO"
**URL:** https://www.makeuseof.com/gpt-models-explained-and-compared/  
**Excerpt:** "GPT-2 was released in 2019 by OpenAI as a successor to GPT-1. It contained a staggering 1.5 billion parameters, considerably larger than GPT-1. The model was trained on a much larger and more diverse dataset, combining Common Crawl and WebText. One of the strengths of GPT-2 was its ability to generate coherent and realistic sequences of text."

### "The Evolution of ChatGPT: History and Future - 365 Data Science"
**URL:** https://365datascience.com/trending/the-evolution-of-chatgpt-history-and-future/  
**Excerpt:** "The most significant GPT-3.5 vs GPT-4 difference is the context window, which increased from around 3,000 words upon ChatGPT's release to approximately 25,000 for GPT-4. In addition, the model produces more factually correct information, has fewer hallucinations, and is less likely to respond to sensitive requests or generate disallowed content."

### "GPT Series: Evolution & Performance Shifts | GPT-3.5 vs. GPT-4 - Techopedia"
**URL:** https://www.techopedia.com/gpt-series-evolution-insights  
**Excerpt:** "GPT-3.5 vs. GPT-4: A Research Study. A research paper emerged from Stanford University and the University of California, Berkeley, that highlighted the shifts in GPT-4 and GPT-3.5's outputs as time progressed. The paper suggests that there has been an overall decline in the performance of these generative pre-trained transformer models."

### "The evolution of GPTs - Educative"
**URL:** https://www.educative.io/blog/evolution-of-gpt  
**Excerpt:** "The blog covers the evolution of GPT models from GPT-1 to GPT-3, emphasizing their increasing complexity and capabilities in tasks like text generation, translation, and creative writing. It also discusses the challenges and advancements in transformer models, including self-attention mechanisms and the handling of long-term dependencies."

episodes.summary: Performed a web search on the evolution of GPT models, yielding multiple sources detailing the development from GPT-1 to GPT-4 and their impact on AI advancement.

result.outputs:
## Search results
### "GPT Series and Evolution — Upstage"
**URL:** https://en.content.upstage.ai/blog/insight/evolution-of-gpt-models  
**Excerpt:** "GPT-3.5 (MARCH 2022) GPT-3.5 is a version with code data and Instruction fine-tuning added to GPT-3. According to the speculation of many researchers, it is not known whether this method directly affects the model, but it is observed that adding code data increases GPT's reasoning ability and understanding of long inputs."

### "The Evolution of ChatGPT: History and Future - 365 Data Science"
**URL:** https://365datascience.com/trending/the-evolution-of-chatgpt-history-and-future/  
**Excerpt:** "The GPT in ChatGPT stands for generative pre-trained transformer —a large language model that uses deep learning to produce human-like speech. In other words, ChatGPT is an AI solution powered by the GPT model. The GPT technology also powers products like OpenAI's Codex, Copy.ai, Jasper, etc."

### "GPT Series: Evolution & Performance Shifts | GPT-3.5 vs. GPT-4 - Techopedia"
**URL:** https://www.techopedia.com/gpt-series-evolution-insights  
**Excerpt:** "GPT-3.5 vs. GPT-4: A Research Study. A research paper emerged from Stanford University and the University of California, Berkeley, that highlighted the shifts in GPT-4 and GPT-3.5's outputs as time progressed. The paper suggests that there has been an overall decline in the performance of these generative pre-trained transformer models."

### "GPT-1 to GPT-4: Each of OpenAI's GPT Models Explained and Compared - MUO"
**URL:** https://www.makeuseof.com/gpt-models-explained-and-compared/  
**Excerpt:** "GPT-2 was released in 2019 by OpenAI as a successor to GPT-1. It contained a staggering 1.5 billion parameters, considerably larger than GPT-1. The model was trained on a much larger and more diverse dataset, combining Common Crawl and WebText. One of the strengths of GPT-2 was its ability to generate coherent and realistic sequences of text."

### "A Look into the Evolution of GPT Models From GPT-1 to GPT-4"
**URL:** https://generativeai.pub/a-look-into-the-evolution-of-gpt-models-from-gpt-1-to-gpt-4-38b68c2f275b  
**Excerpt:** "GPT-3, released in 2020, marked a period of exponential growth for natural language processing models. With 175 billion parameters, GPT-3 was more than a hundred times larger than GPT-1 and over ten times larger than GPT-2. The training data for GPT-3 included BookCorpus, Common Crawl, and Wikipedia, among other sources."

### "GPT — Intuitively and Exhaustively Explained | by Daniel Warfield ..."
**URL:** https://towardsdatascience.com/gpt-intuitively-and-exhaustively-explained-c70c38e87491  
**Excerpt:** "GPT, being a model focused on text generation, is a decoder only style model. The model architecture of GPT-1, a decoder-only style model. source. The decoder-only style of model used in GPT has very similar components to the traditional transformer, but also some important and subtle distinctions."

### "A Brief History of The Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT ..."
**URL:** https://blog.wordbot.io/ai-artificial-intelligence/a-brief-history-of-the-generative-pre-trained-transformer-gpt-language-models/  
**Excerpt:** "The progression of GPT language models has been remarkable, from the earliest GPT-1 model to the latest GPT-4 model. These models have been made possible by the evolution of deep learning techniques and have the potential to revolutionize natural language processing and other applications that rely on text data."

### "The Story of ChatGPT and OpenAI: The Evolution of GPT Models"
**URL:** https://medium.com/illumination/the-story-of-chatgpt-and-openai-the-evolution-of-gpt-models-abf201316a9  
**Excerpt:** "The Evolution of GPT Models. 2018: OpenAI releases GPT-1, a language model with 117 million parameters trained on a dataset of approximately 8 million web pages."

episodes.summary: Executed a web search on the evolution of GPT models, resulting in key insights like the introduction of GPT-3.5 with code data and Instruction fine-tuning, the decline in performance between GPT-3.5 and GPT-4, and the significant growth in parameters from GPT-1 to GPT-3.

Answer gathered from webpage: '''* Evolution of GPT models: A journey from GPT-1 to GPT-4 pushing the boundaries of natural language processing and bringing us closer to creating AI that can understand and generate human-like text.
* GPT-1 to GPT-4: OpenAI's evolution from the genesis of GPT-1 to the groundbreaking advancements of GPT-4, with each iteration redefining the landscape of natural language processing.'''
